title.narrative: EMERGENCY - CHILD PROTECTION RESPONSE TO IDAI

description.narrative: Emergency - Setting up of activities for children in safe spaces and ensuring children are referred to appropriate services, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the poorest and most marginalised children benefit from a more effective child and social protection system (cash and care)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Emergency - Setting up of activities for children in safe spaces and ensuring children are referred to appropriate services

description.narrative: Psycho-social first-aid support was provided to 15,703 children by UNICEF Mozambique child protection partners, primarily through Child Friendly Spaces (CFS), in cyclone affected areas. Seventy-five unaccompanied and separated children (UASC) were identified and reunited with family. Local partners reached people and children with disabilities with community-based interventions, including rehabilitation, assistive devices and psycho social support. In close collaboration with provincial government, UNICEF Mozambique child protection partners provided case management support to 601 of the most vulnerable children and families to gain access to welfare and protection services. In addition, 72,612 individuals were re-issued birth certificates and identification papers. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:14/01/2020

title.narrative: Children receiving psychosocial support through Safe Spaces
Separated and unaccompanied children are identified and are in family-based care or an alternative care
